Name: Token Management for Ticket Sales
Scope: Managing token sales for a concert event
Input: User addresses for tracking ticket purchases
Constraints: Limit of one ticket per user
Golden status users can purchase up to three tickets
Verify Golden status before ticket transfer
Unique identifiers for ticket transfers
PrimaryScenario: Users purchase tickets during two phases, with Golden status users having special privileges and compensation in case of cancellation
AlternativeScenario: Ticket resale prevention and secure online platform for ticket transfers

Name: User Ticket Purchase Limitation
Constraints: Golden status users can purchase up to 3 tickets
Regular users can purchase 1 ticket

Name: Golden User Ticket Transfer
Scope: Managing ticket transfers for Golden status users
Constraints: User can transfer maximum of three tickets if Golden status
Verification required before transfer
PrimaryScenario: Golden status user transfers up to three tickets to other users
AlternativeScenario: Non-Golden status user attempts to transfer tickets

Name: Address Tracking for Purchase Limitation
Scope: Tracking user addresses to enforce the limit of one ticket per user
Constraints: Limit of one ticket per user
Verification of Golden status users
AlternativeScenario: Golden status user tries to purchase more than three tickets

Name: Golden User Verification
Constraints: Verify user status before transfer
PrimaryScenario: Golden status user successfully purchases tickets
AlternativeScenario: Non-Golden status user attempts to purchase more than allowed tickets

Name: Ticket Sales Phases
Scope: Ticket sales management for concert tokens
Constraints: One ticket per user
Golden users limited to three tickets
Ticket transfer verification for Golden users
Second phase ticket sales for Golden users only
Output: Compensation calculation in case of cancellation
PrimaryScenario: Users buy tickets according to their status, with Golden users being able to transfer up to three tickets in both phases
AlternativeScenario: Unauthorized ticket purchase or transfer attempts, event cancellation scenario

Name: Golden User Exclusivity in Second Phase
Scope: Ensure that only Golden status users can purchase tickets in the second phase of ticket sales
Constraints: Users with Golden status can purchase up to three tickets
Only Golden status users can participate in the second phase
User address tracking for ticket purchase validation
Output: Exclusive access to ticket purchase in second phase for Golden status users
PrimaryScenario: Golden status users successfully purchase tickets in the second phase
AlternativeScenario: Non-Golden status users attempt to purchase tickets in the second phase but are blocked

Name: User Verification for Second Phase
Scope: Verification process for users to purchase tickets in the second phase
Input: Number of tickets purchased by user in first phase
Constraints: User must have Golden status indicated in their blockchain profile
User must not have purchased more than 3 tickets in the first phase
Output: User verification status for purchasing tickets in the second phase
PrimaryScenario: Verify user's Golden status before allowing ticket purchase in the second phase
AlternativeScenario: User does not have Golden status and is unable to purchase tickets in the second phase

Name: EventCancellationCompensation
Scope: Handling compensation in case of event cancellation for different ticket tiers
Constraints: Golden ticket holders receive 25% extra compensation
Platinum ticket holders receive 5% extra compensation
Bronze ticket holders receive no extra compensation
Output: Calculated compensation amount for each ticket tier
PrimaryScenario: Event is cancelled, and compensation is automatically processed for ticket holders
AlternativeScenario: No event cancellation occurs and no compensation is required

Name: Ticket Transfer Security
Constraints: Limiting ticket purchases to one per user
Enforcing Golden status ticket limits
Secure online platform for ticket transfers
Output: Prevention of ticket resale at inflated prices
Compensation in case of event cancellation

Name: Unique Ticket Identifiers
Scope: To ensure each ticket purchased is uniquely identified for security and verification purposes
PrimaryScenario: Tickets purchased are assigned unique identifiers linked to user addresses
AlternativeScenario: Tickets without unique identifiers are rejected at the entrance
